title: cannot explore experiment runs [AWS EB, S3]
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**: yes
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: 18.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: pip
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: 1.0.0
- **Python version**: 3.6
- **npm version (if running the dev UI):
- **Exact command to reproduce**: 
```
    CMD mlflow server \
    --backend-store-uri /mlflow/myruns \
    --default-artifact-root s3://${BUCKET}/mlflow-artifacts \
    --host 0.0.0.0
```
### Describe the problem
I am deploying mlflow to an AWS EB server. Artifacts are stored in s3. Everything seems to be working in the sense that I can load up the mlflow start page, see the different experiments and they get populated with respective metadata. However, when I click on a run to view (i.e. to look at the metrics or artifacts) it crashes and i get the Oops Niagra Falls page. Going into the deployed docker image, all files are present and metadata is being populated and updated. 

```
Failed to load resource: http://1234.elasticbeanstalk.com/ajax-api/2.0/preview/mlflow/artifacts/list?run_uuid=1234 the server responded with a status of 500 (INTERNAL SERVER ERROR)
```
